title:
Consider the following reaction:

$$C_2 H_4$$ (g) + $$H_2$$ (g) ⇌ $$C_2 H_6$$ (g)

At 298K, the standard Gibbs free energy change, ∆G° for this reaction is $$-32.89$$ $$ rac{kJ}{mol}$$. The standard heats of formation, ∆$$H_f$$°, are as follows: $$C_2 H_4$$ (g) $$=$$ $$52.47$$ $$ rac{kJ}{mol}$$, $$H_2$$ (g) $$=$$ $$0$$ $$ rac{kJ}{mol}$$, and $$C_2 H_6$$ (g) $$=$$ $$-84.68$$ $$ rac{kJ}{mol}$$.
body: Show your work for all the problems and save the document. You will be asked to submit the work for credit. Please complete the entire module in a single sitting.\n For each answer input box, enter only a numeric response without commas, units, or additional formatting.
